text: Prepare the kiwifruit. Using a vegetable peeler, remove the rough outer skin from each kiwifruit. Chop the flesh up roughly. Remove the outer layer of the onion. Chop finely. Slice the chillies finely. Be sure to remove all traces of the seeds. This step is best done wearing gloves. Be careful not to wipe you eyes or nasal cavity if the chillies have come into contact with your fingers. Place all of the chopped ingredients into the saucepan. Add the chopped ginger, sugar and vinegar. Over a medium heat, cook the kiwifruit for 50 minutes, or until the mixture thickens and appears pulp-like.  Sterilise the storage container jars. Dry them and have them ready, hot for pouring in the relish. Transfer the cooked relish into the hot jars. Seal while still hot. Keep opened relish in the fridge for up to a month. Store unopened relish in a pantry for up to 6 months. Check for any mould growth; discard if this occurs. Finished.
